definition: Wu dialects (spoken primarily in Shanghai and surrounding areas)
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods

sentences.english: This feature accords with the fact that Wu dialects are approaching to a verb-final type.
sentences.chinese: 这与吴语正在接近动词居末类型的事实是相和谐的。

sentences.english: Mont scholars in Chinese dialectology believe that the northern border of ancient Wu dialect is Huai River.
sentences.chinese: 汉语方言学界一般认为古吴语北至淮河流域。

sentences.english: This thesis mainly discusses the post-positions of Suichang dialect, a Wu dialect.
sentences.chinese: 本文集中讨论吴语遂昌话的后置成分。

sentences.english: These characteristics are closely near with the three personal pronouns of modern Wu dialect.
sentences.chinese: 这些特征已和现代吴语的三身代词相近。

sentences.english: Most scholars in Chinese dialectology believe that the northern border of ancient Wu dialect is Huai River.
sentences.chinese: 汉语方言学界一般认为古吴语北至淮河流域。

definition: Suzhou dialect, one of the main Wu dialects 吳語|吴语[Wu2 yu3]
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
Min dialects, spoken in Fujian Province, Taiwan etc
Huizhou dialect of Gan, spoken in southern parts of Anhui Province
Gan dialect, spoken in Jiangxi Province
Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
